content.title: Journey of a Design
content.creator:
MIDILLI
January 1, 2025
content.content:
Hello everyone,
As the new year approaches, I wanted to share another update, this time about the behind-the-scenes process I mentioned earlier.
What happens after design?
Letâ€™s imagine a design: 4 knobs with unique caps, a black-and-white screen, and 4 black push buttons featuring white ring LEDs. Here's how it looks:
The image above is what you see. Below is, how their positioning looks like with placeholder drill holes and their center positions:
This allows me to quickly check alignment and later compare it with the final result.
Journey begins
To streamline the process, I've developed two custom programs that automate converting your design into formats suitable for the laser engraving machine (SVG) and the CNC machine (G-code). These programs will be made available for free after the campaign ends. 
If youâ€™ve chosen a wood design, production will be completed using the laser engraving machine. For those whoâ€™ve (also) opted for aluminum Dibond printing, CNC will join the production. Below, you can see the conversion of your design into SVG format:
Then, each side of the board is sent to the machine. A time-lapse can be seen below:
Once the cutting and engraving are complete, the wood is varnished, and the components are put in place:
Finally, the components are soldered, making the controller ready for testing and shipment!
Let me know if you have questions or feedback!

content.title: Day 2: Project Update: Progress and New Features
content.creator:
MIDILLI
December 1, 2024
content.content:
The initial idea for this project began in April 2024, and since then, it has grown into something far larger than I ever anticipated. The MIDILLI Designer now contains over 6,000 lines of code, the Configurator has over 2,000, the firmware over 1,000, and the web API is nearing 1,000 lines. Beyond the sheer coding effort, this has involved countless hours of research and non-coding tasks, making it the biggest project Iâ€™ve ever taken on. I'll share more details about the technologies behind it in the future. But today, I want to focus on the updates made to the Designer since the trailer.
Text Color Customization for Buttons
Previously, I introduced the ability to assign unique names to each button. However, before launching the campaign, The feature for customizing text colors was not ready before the trailer was made. With this update, you can now change the text colors for buttons on controllers that use a custom design image (e.g., alu-dibond options).
Color picker allows you to find your text color, offering all possible color choices for ultimate customization.
Batch Customization Enhancements
A small yet impactful update: you can now make bulk changes to all selected elements within the same category in the Batch Customization section. This includes the ability to apply a single text color across all selected elements.
Introducing the Info Window
A new addition to the Designer is the Info Window. It will display helpful suggestions, warnings about potential issues in your design, or relevant details you might need later while using the Configurator.
Designed to be informative without being annoying.
Configurator Updates
One exciting new feature in the Configurator is the MIDI Listener.
A teaser is also in the image.
This allows you to test your connected controller's settings without leaving the app. The Info Window has also been added to the Configurator, providing suggestions and highlighting important details during configuration.
Generic Updates
In many programs, error messages or notification dialogs don't allow copying text for troubleshooting. To address this common issue, Iâ€™ve made it possible to copy any message from dialogs, notifications, or the Info Window directly to your clipboard! In case you need support or just to keep it somewhere â€” no more screenshots or typing the whole message to search for an answer! Your time is valuable!
Hardware and Web Updates
The CNC machine for cutting, component placement, and engraving is on its way.
Work on the website's backend is ongoing, and once ready, youâ€™ll be able to try out the MIDILLI Designer directly on the site. While the Terms and Conditions are not finalized yet, rest assured that everything will remain on your browser and your computer until you press the Submit Project button.
Thank you for your continued support and enthusiasm. Stay tuned for more updates!
